title: Circular Walk around Silsoe Route

images.title: Rodney Burton / Church and War Memorial, Silsoe, Beds
images.caption: Church, village sign and War Memorial, Silsoe, Beds. The church of St James is built of local sandstone, with chancel, nave, aisles and an embattled tower containing 3 bells; it was rebuilt in 1831 and alterations were made in 1884. The village sign (left) is at the top of the avenue approach to Wrest Park.

images.title: Rodney Burton / Local Shop, Silsoe, Beds
images.caption: Local Shop, Silsoe, Beds. Newsagency and estate agents with 26 High Street on the left.

images.title: Rodney Burton / Old School House, Silsoe, Beds
images.caption: Old School House. Now private residences, the School House Mews and Coach House (right).

images.title: Rodney Burton / Star and Garter public house, Silsoe, Beds
images.caption: The Star and Garter public house in the High Street, Silsoe; to the rear is part of the tower of St James' church.

images.caption: Little Ion Farmhouse, Gravenhurst

description: This attractive village in Bedfordshire is home to English Heritage's Wrest Park . The estate provided the village with a number of its historic features including the St James's church, the old school and a row of picturesque almhouses. This circular walk around the village takes you through the countryside surrounding the impressive Wrest Park . You'll also visit the Silsoe Nature Reserve and Park on the southern side of the settlement. The walk starts in the village and heads east, skirting the edge of Wrest Park. There's some beautiful 'Capability' Brown landscaped gardens and a series of canals in this 92 acre park. You continue south along bridge tracks to Higham Gobion before turning north to Fielden Court. The trail then heads through Buckle Grove Wood before entering the Silsoe Nature Reserve and Park. There's some nice easy footpaths here with ponds and wildlife to see. You can also pick up a footpath heading south west from here to Pulloxhill if you would like to extend the walk.
